author: @nbcchicago
title: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted gifts worth millions of dollars over 20 years, analysis finds
text:
Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted millions of dollars‚Äô worth of gifts over two decades on the bench, according to a new data analysis. The figure sets Thomas far apart from his current colleagues, according to the nonprofit Fix the Court. The analysis provides fodder for Supreme Court critics who have called for reforms in the wake of a series of politically incendiary rulings and ongoing ethics scandals. Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas accepted millions of dollars‚Äô worth of gifts over the past two decades on the bench, a total nearly 10 times the value of all gifts received by his fellow justices during the same time, according to a new analysis.
Thomas received 103 gifts with a total value of more than $2.4 million between 2004 and 2023, the judicial reform group Fix the Court said in a report Thursday.
In contrast, Thomas‚Äô fellow justices over the same period accepted a total of just 93 gifts worth a combined value of only about $248,000, according to the nonprofit group.
Thomas‚Äô fellow conservative justice Samuel Alito accounted for the lion‚Äôs share of that value. Fix the Court‚Äôs analysis found that Alito accepted 16 gifts worth a combined $170,095.
Fix the Court identified another 101 ‚Äúlikely gifts‚Äù ‚Äî with a total estimated value of almost $1.8 million ‚Äîthat Thomas received in the form of free trips and lodging from billionaire businessman Harlan Crow, and at the exclusive Bohemian Grove club.
Counting those gifts, Thomas‚Äô total two-decade haul is valued at nearly $4.2 million.
Fix the Court‚Äôs analysis is largely based on investigative reporting by the media outlet ProPublica over the past year, which has been focused on Thomas and Alito and which has sparked calls for ethics reform at the Supreme Court.
The group also factored in data from the Congressional Record, the justices‚Äô annual financial disclosures, other news sources, and its own law clerk-led research.
The value and number of gifts Thomas received also eclipsed those accepted by eight retired or dead Supreme Court justices whose tenures overlapped his service on the court, which began in 1991.
The late Justice Sandra Day O‚ÄôConnor, who served more than 34 years on the court, received 73 gifts until she retired in early 2006, putting her in second place behind Thomas in total number of gifts.
But the combined value of O‚ÄôConnor‚Äôs gifts was less than $36,000.
Antonin Scalia, a conservative justice who died in 2016 while on the court, accepted 67 gifts worth about $210,000 during his tenure, which began in 1986.
The late Chief Justice William Rehnquist, whose career on the court spanned 33 years until 2005, accepted just six gifts, with a total value of less than $13,000.
‚ÄúSupreme Court justices should not be accepting gifts, let alone the hundreds of freebies worth millions of dollars they‚Äôve received over the years,‚Äù Fix the Court‚Äôs executive director, Gabe Roth, said in a statement.
‚ÄúThe ethics crisis at the Court won‚Äôt begin to abate until justices adopt stricter gift acceptance rules,‚Äù Roth said.
Fix the Court noted that the total figures it calculated for gift values are likely lower than the actual values because the analysis erred on the low end of the cost of some gifts, such as free travel or tickets to sports events.
Its tally also makes some assumptions. The group assumed the cost per hour of a flight on a private plane is $10,000, for instance, and it counted each leg of a roundtrip flight as a separate gift.
The Supreme Court did not immediately respond to CNBC‚Äôs request for comment on Fix the Court‚Äôs findings.
ProPublica first revealed that Thomas had accepted years of luxury trips from Republican megadonor Crow without reporting them on his financial disclosures, which ethics experts said he was required to do.
Thomas said his judicial colleagues had told him that he did not have to disclose those travel expenses.
The analysis nevertheless provides fodder for the Supreme Court‚Äôs increasingly vocal critics who have called for reforms in the wake of a series of politically incendiary rulings and ongoing ethics scandals .
The court under Chief Justice John Roberts has made some concessions, including adopting a formal ‚Äî though unenforceable ‚Äî code of ethics in November.
The court in that document aimed to ‚Äúdispel‚Äù the ‚Äúmisunderstanding‚Äù that the court‚Äôs nine justices ‚Äúregard themselves as unrestricted by any ethics rules.‚Äù
The federal judiciary, meanwhile, implemented new rules this year requiring Supreme Court justices to disclose the value of travel-related gifts on their financial disclosure forms.

author: salvador hern√°ndez v√©lez
title: Las plantas podr√≠an vivir sin nosotros, pero nosotros no podr√≠amos vivir sin ellas
text: Como humanos apenas dirigimos nuestra mirada hacia las plantas, pasamos a su ‚Äúlado con gran indiferencia‚Äù, y no somos conscientes de que no podemos vivir sin ellas; en cambio, ellas sin nosotros, s√≠. Stefano Mancuso y Alessandra Viola, en su libro Sensibilidad e inteligencia en el mundo vegetal, advierten que en la Tierra el mundo vegetal ocupa el 99.7 por ciento, mientras que el mundo animal el porcentaje restante. Para nosotros las plantas son inm√≥viles e insensibles. No se desplazan. Pero, lo que para nosotros es un problema, para las plantas no, m√°s bien les ha permitido evolucionar de manera diferente a nosotros. Las plantas gozan de un cuerpo modular y los del reino animal de √≥rganos √∫nicos, es decir, indivisibles. Si a las plantas les cortamos grandes fragmentos de su cuerpo, no mueren, pero los humanos s√≠. Si alguien las corta a la mitad, brotan. Reviven. Por ejemplo, si a un ocotillo (fouquieria splendens) le cortamos un tallo que parece seco y lo plantamos, enra√≠za y puede crecer otro ocotillo, porque es modular. A nosotros, si en un accidente, como dec√≠a mi mam√° ‚Äúni Dios lo mande‚Äù, sufri√©ramos el corte de un brazo, no hay manera que del brazo se desarrolle un ser humano. TE PUEDE INTERESAR: Armando Navarro Favela ‚ÄòCuiri‚Äô, un viesquense forjado por el trabajo diario Si aceptamos que inteligencia es la capacidad de resolver problemas, podemos apuntar que la inteligencia de las plantas es sublime, pues cuando les cortan una de sus partes, zanjan el problema, reto√±ando o generando otra planta. Empero los que pertenecemos al mundo animal somos incapaces para resolver problemas de esa naturaleza. Las investigaciones cient√≠ficas de los √∫ltimos cincuenta a√±os, han demostrado que las plantas son sensibles, tienen sentidos: vista, olfato, o√≠do, gusto y tacto; aunque no tengan, ojos, nariz, orejas, gl√°ndulas gustativas y piel. Hay quienes afirman que poseen otros quince sentidos. La vista es ‚Äúel sentido corporal con que se perciben los objetos mediante la acci√≥n de la luz‚Äù y ‚Äúque permite ver las cosas materiales‚Äù, seg√∫n los diccionarios de la Real Academia y el general de la lengua espa√±ola Vox. Entonces, si hablamos de ‚Äúacci√≥n de la luz‚Äù, ‚Äúpercepci√≥n de los objetos‚Äù y ‚Äúcosas materiales‚Äù, las plantas se hallan en plena posesi√≥n de este sentido porque son capaces de interceptar la luz, usarla y reconocer su cantidad como su calidad, esto es porque la luz es el principal componente de su dieta energ√©tica para efectuar la fotos√≠ntesis. Por ejemplo, en Torre√≥n hay una palma abajo de una cornisa de un edificio sobre el bulevar Rodr√≠guez Triana y, ante la pobreza de luz, el tallo se torci√≥ para localizarla y seguir creciendo hac√≠a la luz. Sobre el sentido del olfato, Mancuso y Viola dicen que las plantas tienen una sensibilidad difusa para ‚Äúoler‚Äù, mientras que nosotros usamos s√≥lo la nariz, ellas lo hacen con todo su organismo, como si tuvieran millones de peque√±as narices repartidas por todo el cuerpo. Con respecto al gusto, los √≥rganos de √©stas son receptores de sustancias qu√≠micas que buscan alimento en el suelo, gracias a la acci√≥n exploradora de las ra√≠ces. Ante el cuestionamiento sobre la prox√©mica: ¬øPercibe la planta el contacto? Para ello se√±alan que basta con observar el comportamiento de la Mimosa pudica, un tipo de planta sensitiva, que cuando la tocas retrae las hojas. Quien identific√≥ esta capacidad de la mimosa fue Jean-Baptiste Lamarck, inventor de la palabra ‚Äúbiolog√≠a‚Äù. Tambi√©n nos hablan de la capacidad de las plantas carn√≠voras para sentir cuando un insecto se posa sobre sus hojas, comportamiento que requiere por fuerza del tacto. Y se preguntan: ¬øOyen las plantas? Y ¬øqu√© son los sonidos? Vibraciones que se desplazan por el aire en forma de ondas sonoras captadas por el pabell√≥n auricular de los humanos. Pero las plantas no tienen o√≠do externo, y nos recuerdan que tampoco las v√≠boras y los gusanos lo tienen y, pese a ello, oyen porque poseen en su interior un √≥ptimo conductor de vibraciones. Tambi√©n estos estudiosos nos hablan de los otros sentidos que poseen las plantas: pueden medir con precisi√≥n la humedad, detectar la gravedad, los campos electromagn√©ticos, reconocer y medir un sinn√∫mero de gradientes qu√≠micos presentes en el aire o en la tierra. Sin duda hay muchas cuestiones sin responder porque queda mucho por descubrir. Lo que es un hecho es que los animales dependen de las plantas y las plantas del sol. jshv0851@gmail.com https://vanguardia.com.mx/binrepository/1024x1024/0c111/1024d801/none/11604/GNQQ/04_1-9388725_20240704163010.png $urlImage

title: Arriva il freddo | pioggia temporali e neve in arrivo per il weekend
text: Roma - weekend caratterizzato da un'improvvisa ondata di freddo che porter√† piogge, temporali e nevicate anche a quote medie sull'Appennino, con un abbassamento delle temperature. Un weekend instabile e pi√π freddo sta per colpire l'Italia, grazie all'arrivo di un vortice di bassa pressione proveniente dalle latitudini mediterranee. Dopo aver attraversato la penisola gioved√¨, questo sistema sar√† rinvigorito da un'improvvisa spinta di aria fredda che arriver√† dal Mare del Nord, portando con s√© piogge, temporali e un abbassamento delle temperature. Ma non solo: a partire da sabato, l'Appennino vedr√† un ritorno della neve a quote medie, con la previsione di nevicate gi√† a partire dai 1000-1200 metri. Non tutte le regioni subiranno allo stesso modo gli effetti del maltempo. Centro e Sud saranno le aree pi√π colpite dal nuovo impulso, mentre al Nord la situazione risulter√† pi√π tranquilla, con fenomeni pi√π isolati.Leggi su Abruzzo24ore.tv Abruzzo24ore.tv - Arriva il freddo: pioggia, temporali e neve in arrivo per il weekend - Freddo artico e neve all'Immacolata con temporali e venti forti, quanto dura il maltempo: le previsioni meteo - Maltempo in arrivo: freddo, pioggia e neve colpiscono l‚ÄôItalia dal Nord al Sud - Meteo, freddo in arrivo e nuove piogge: temperature in calo anche di 10 gradi - Meteo, allerta gialla nel Lazio: a Roma arriva freddo, vento e temporali. Manca pochissimo all‚Äôarrivo di una nuova e intensa ... author: Agencia EFE
title: La Fiscal√≠a de Per√∫ amplia investigaci√≥n a Boluarte por el 'Rolexgate'
text:
La Fiscal√≠a de Per√∫ amplia investigaci√≥n a Boluarte por el 'Rolexgate'
El caso incluye tambi√©n la posible comisi√≥n del delito de cohecho pasivo impropio
La Fiscal√≠a de Per√∫ inform√≥ este mi√©rcoles 14 de abril de 2024 que ampli√≥ la investigaci√≥n preliminar a la presidenta Dina Boluarte en el caso de los relojes de lujo Rolex que exhibi√≥ en varios actos, al incluir la posible comisi√≥n de un delito de cohecho pasivo impropio, que se suma al de enriquecimiento il√≠cito.
(Los invitamos tambi√©n a leer:
"Allanamiento a Boluarte quiebra la constitucionalidad", dice el Gobierno de Per√∫)
La presidenta de Per√∫ declara de manera inesperada ante el fiscal general
Leer m√°s
A trav√©s del √Årea de Enriquecimiento Il√≠cito y Denuncias Constitucionales, el Ministerio P√∫blico anunci√≥ que ha expandido la investigaci√≥n preliminar abierta a la mandataria por la supuesta comisi√≥n de los delitos de enriquecimiento il√≠cito y omisi√≥n de consignar declaraciones en documentos.
Detall√≥ que dispuso ampliar la pesquisa para comprender a Boluarte por hechos referidos a la presunta comisi√≥n del delito de cohecho pasivo impropio.
Tambi√©n anunci√≥ que ampli√≥ las investigaciones preliminares para comprender al gobernador regional de Ayacucho, Wilfredo Oscorima, quien admiti√≥ que prest√≥ los relojes de lujo a la mandataria, por la presunta comisi√≥n de delitos de cohecho activo gen√©rico.
Tras el allanamiento de su vivienda y el Palacio de Gobierno el 30 de marzo, como parte de esta investigaci√≥n, la jefa de Estado declar√≥ el 5 de abril durante m√°s de cinco horas ante la Fiscal√≠a y luego dio un pronunciamiento ante la prensa en el que neg√≥ tener relojes de la marca Rolex y otras joyas valoradas en miles de d√≥lares.
Una nueva crisis pol√≠tica vive Per√∫, tras el allanamiento a la vivienda de la presidenta Dina Boluarte y el Palacio de Gobierno por un equipo policial y fiscal que buscaba los relojes de lujo no declarados por la mandataria.‚Äî Diario Expreso (@Expresoec)
Ampl√≠a la nota:
 [April 1, 2024]
"Debo reconocer que fue una equivocaci√≥n haber aceptado en calidad de pr√©stamo estos relojes de mi amigo Wilfredo Oscorima", agreg√≥ antes de indicar que los luci√≥ "en el √°nimo de representar bien al pa√≠s" y ya los ha devuelto a su propietario.
Boluarte tambi√©n asegur√≥ que "todo lo que han dicho es falso" sobre la posesi√≥n de joyas valoradas en miles de d√≥lares antes de mostrar una pulsera, un collar y pendientes que, seg√∫n dijo, son "de bisuter√≠a fina" y de plata, respectivamente.
Cinco d√≠as m√°s tarde, la Fiscal√≠a incaut√≥ tres relojes Rolex y una pulsera que son propiedad de Oscorima, que es empresario dedicado a los casinos y apuestas, ha sido tres veces gobernador de Ayacucho y tiene varias investigaciones abiertas por el Ministerio P√∫blico por delitos de corrupci√≥n.
¬øQuieres acceder a todo el contenido de calidad sin l√≠mites?
¬°SUSCR√çBETE AQU√ç!

author: infocampo
title: En medio de la primavera m√°s c√°lida de la que se tengan registros, hay nuevos alertas por tormentas
text:
El Servicio Meteorol√≥gico Nacional (SMN) puso este jueves bajo riesgo de alerta por tormentas , naranja y amarillo, a gran parte del centro del pa√≠s y el nordeste argentino (NEA) .
Puntualmente, toda la provincia de C√≥rdoba y una porci√≥n del centro de Santa Fe son las zonas donde se advierte una peligrosidad mayor, con lluvias intensas que podr√≠an llegar a 90 mil√≠metros , fuertes r√°fagas de viento y probables episodios de granizo.
En tanto, el alerta amarillo rige para el resto de Santa Fe, San Luis, gran parte de Mendoza, Santiago del Estero, Chaco y Formosa; sudeste de Catamarca y La Rioja; y noroeste de Corrientes.
12 DIC ‚ö†Ô∏è #Alerta para hoy:
‚õàÔ∏è #Tormenta
‚ö†Ô∏è Lluvias intensas
üüß 40-90 mm
üå¨Ô∏è R√°fagas
üßä Granizo
üü® 20-50 mm con üå¨Ô∏è r√°fagas entre 50 y 90 km/h
üßä Granizo
üì≤ M√°s informaci√≥n y recomendaciones: https://t.co/GRjfngGukd pic.twitter.com/vy9RqJMTmb
‚Äî SMN Argentina (@SMN_Argentina) December 12, 2024
Esto ocurre en medio de una moment√°nea ola de calor que se ha sentido con fuerza en varias regiones de la Argentina.
Por ejemplo, en C√≥rdoba, el Ministerio de Bioagroindustria report√≥ temperaturas que llegaron a superar los 40¬∞C el mi√©rcoles por la tarde.
UNA PRIMAVERA CON MUCH√çSIMO CALOR En rigor, en general la primavera ha transcurrido en condiciones extremadamente c√°lidas , al punto que es la que tiene los mayores registros de temperaturas desde que el SMN releva datos al respecto, seg√∫n report√≥ el propio organismo en un ‚Äúhilo‚Äù que arm√≥ a trav√©s de la red social X.
All√≠ reflej√≥ que esta es por muy amplio margen la primavera m√°s c√°lida , con cerca de 1,5¬∞C por encima de la media, superando al mayor registro anterior que databa de 2014, con 0,9¬∞.
üìç Ciudades con primavera m√°s c√°lida
El calor se sinti√≥ m√°s intenso en la franja central del pa√≠s, donde 42 localidades batieron sus propios #r√©cords de temperatura en este trimestre. pic.twitter.com/xkUG0Bz2IK
‚Äî SMN Argentina (@SMN_Argentina) December 11, 2024
Asimismo, otro indicador es que hubo 42 localidades argentinas que batieron su r√©cord de temperatura para esta estaci√≥n . En similar sinton√≠a, 12 provincias superaron sus marcas hist√≥ricas.
En cuanto a las lluvias, si bien esta primavera no ha sido r√©cord, s√≠ est√° siendo la mejor en aporte pluviom√©trico desde 2018 .
üåßÔ∏è ¬øY las lluvias?
Aunque la primavera 2024 no fue r√©cord en lluvias, s√≠ fue la m√°s lluviosa desde 2018.
üëÄ Sin embargo, las precipitaciones fueron muy desiguales seg√∫n la regi√≥n. pic.twitter.com/nwk6naj7HK
‚Äî SMN Argentina (@SMN_Argentina) December 11, 2024

author: Amy Yutzy
title: GUEST COLUMN: Whole-person care supports patients, saves money
text:
The pandemic-prompted Public Health Emergency ensured that members of Health First Colorado, our state‚Äôs Medicaid program, benefited from continuous health coverage during a tumultuous time.
But that emergency period expired in May. Since then, Colorado has worked hard so that anyone eligible for Health First Colorado continues to benefit from health coverage.
While maintaining coverage is critical, it‚Äôs only half of the equation to better health.
Improving the overall health of Coloradans also requires that those with health coverage can access high-quality, comprehensive care.
For Health First Colorado members, that increasingly includes wrap-around services that promote their well-being.
A person‚Äôs health depends on more than what can be addressed in a doctor‚Äôs office. It‚Äôs influenced by broader factors known as social determinants of health.
The understanding of the drivers of good health requires an expanded focus on ‚Äúwhole person care.‚Äù
We cannot fully care for patients unless we ask them about and address their full spectrum of needs.
People cannot thrive without consistent access to nutritious food and a roof over their heads, for example. Sometimes, the needs are even more specific.
The growing Food as Medicine movement acknowledges that some people have special dietary needs because of a health condition or to support their treatment. Meals that meet their health needs help keep them out of the hospital and support healing. This can include ‚Äúproduce prescriptions‚Äù for fruits and vegetables.
For example, the Colorado Community Health Alliance has collaborated with Project Angel Heart to reduce hospital stays for Health First Colorado members with diabetes.
Our pilot program provided an eight-week dietary-tailored meal service. The alliance paid for the meals that Project Angel Heart provided.
Here‚Äôs an example of how it has played out:
A pregnant single mother of two other children was induced due to gestational diabetes. The challenging situation was compounded when her newborn had to stay in the hospital.
Project Angel Heart swiftly initiated a meal delivery program that proved to be a lifeline. The consistent, healthy meal deliveries not only eased the new mom‚Äôs daily burdens but also helped her successfully manage her blood sugar levels.
‚ÄúThe meals helped me take better care of myself,‚Äù the mom told Colorado Community Health Alliance.
Data supports the case for this support.
Members who completed the meal service program decreased their inpatient care costs. On average, these members had inpatient costs of $1,834 per member per month before receiving meals and an average of $692 per member per month after receiving their meals. These savings far exceeded the cost of delivering the meals.
This also demonstrates that healthier outcomes don‚Äôt just benefit the patient but also reduce the costs of taxpayer-supported programs like Health First Colorado.
With the success of this project, the alliance is continuing this pilot project and expanding it to other chronic conditions beyond diabetes. It is also offering it to high-risk pregnant or postpartum women.
Those of us who provide health coverage and care must respond to this expanded understanding of how to support patients‚Äô health.
If we build on this progress, we will support a healthier, happier Colorado while saving money for the state.
Amy Yutzy is executive director of Medicaid Programs with the Colorado Community Health Alliance. She lives in Palmer Lake. Colorado Community Health Alliance is the Health First Colorado regional organization for the counties of Boulder, Broomfield, Clear Creek, El Paso, Gilpin, Jefferson, Park and Teller.

author: John Farnam
title: Jews, Israelis, Sovereign Citizens, ...You Can't Trust Them With Guns
text: Opinion ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always good to have lifeguards nearby, but it‚Äôs better to learn how to swim!‚Äù ~ Sam Rosenberg. Joe R Biden‚Äôs Administration is, even today, still [refusing to sell 27000 US-manufactured M4 rifles](https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/u-s-blocks-shipment-of-rifles-to-israel-over-concerns-of-west-bank-settler-violence-9764c87d) to Israel, for emergency defense. There are those within the JRB Administration who express concern that some of these rifles could ‚Äúend up‚Äù in the hands of (Heaven forbid!) Israeli civilians, who might actually keep them in their homes for personal/home defense (a drill many Israelis sincerely wish they had practiced prior to 7 Oct 23). ‚ÄúArmed Jews‚Äù still apparently represent a truly frightening thought to leftist politicians, both here and ironically in Israel itself! They worry that these weapons might be used to threaten innocent domestic Palestinians (even though no such assaults have occurred). And yet, JRB [nonchalantly abandoned many times that ](https://www.ammoland.com/2022/11/full-list-of-american-weapons-left-afghanistan/)number of American military-grade M4s in Afghanistan during his panicked, helter-skelter ‚Äúwithdrawal‚Äù in the summer of 2021. One can only wonder where all that forsaken American [military equipment ended up.[read Hamas]](https://www.ammoland.com/2023/10/afghanistan-weapons-abandoned-by-biden-administration-appear-in-hamas-terror-attacks/) I think it is safe to say that none of it ended up in the hands of Israelis! The real issue here is that even governments that profess to be ‚Äúenlightened‚Äù still don‚Äôt trust the very citizens who put them in power. The concept of ‚Äúarmed citizens‚Äù (Jews and everyone else) is always morbidly scary to aspiring autocrats who contemptuously look down upon the rest of us and see nothing more than a motley assortment of fools, bigots, clowns, and buffoons, their words! They don‚Äôt even trust members of our own (un)armed services, who have courageously volunteered to defend our nation. Leftist politicians will never respect us as sovereign citizens. We will always scare them. They have regard for none of us despite their less-than-honest rhetoric.
